com.ecs.utils.stellent
Class LWFacade

java.lang.Object
  com.ecs.utils.stellent.LWFacade
Direct Known Subclasses:
LWSSFacade
public class LWFacade
extends java.lang.Object

The class contains a number of Stellent functions which utilise the IdcServerBean package.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Gordon Sandeman

LWFacade

public LWFacade()
Constructor which creates a LWFacade with a connection to port 4444 on the localhost and the sysadmin user.

LWFacade

public LWFacade(java.lang.String userName)
Constructor which creates a LWFacade with a connection to the default port on the localhost as the passed user user.

LWFacade

public LWFacade(java.lang.String serverName,
                java.lang.String userName)
Constructor which takes the Stellent server name and the user name the services called on the connection will be validated against. Assumes a default port of 4444.

Parameters:
serverName - Stellent server host name
userName - Stellent user name

LWFacade

public LWFacade(java.lang.String serverName,
                java.lang.String userName,
                java.lang.String port)
Constructor which takes the Stellent server name, user name and server port. Services called on the connection will be validated against the passed user name.

Parameters:
serverName - Stellent server host name
userName - Stellent user name
port - Stellent Content Server port
Method Detail

setServerPort

public static void setServerPort(java.lang.String port)
Static for setting the default SCS port when invoking the facade. Used by the ECSBaseUtils StartCheck to ensure that when BaseUtils runs within the SCS the default port is always set to the SCS actual port.

Parameters:
port -

public java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream executeServiceRaw(idcbean.data.LWDataBinder binder)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
Executes the service defined in the passed binder and returns the ByteArrayOutputStream unparsed (i.e. non-binder) response. Use the .toString() method to rebuild the Byte Array.

Parameters:
binder - LWDataBinder containing the Stellent service definition
Returns:
ByteArrayOutputStream containing the raw (unparsed) bytes from the response

executeUpdate

public idcbean.data.LWDataBinder executeUpdate(idcbean.data.LWDataBinder binder)
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
This function executes the UPDATE_DOCINFO service using the information passed in the binder. The binder is returned by the function if the service call completes successfully.

Parameters:
binder - LWDataBinder holding document update information
Returns:
LWDataBinder
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

executeForcedUpdate

public idcbean.data.LWDataBinder executeForcedUpdate(idcbean.data.LWDataBinder binder)
                                              throws java.lang.Exception
This function executes a special update service using the information passed in the binder. The binder is returned by the function if the service call completes successfully. The update service will always apply any metadata changes, and they will not get overwritten once a pending item finishes processing.

Parameters:
binder - LWDataBinder holding document update information
Returns:
LWDataBinder
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

binderHasErrors

public boolean binderHasErrors(idcbean.data.LWDataBinder binder)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
Checks the passed binder for errors. If any errors found these are logged as warnings to the default log.

Parameters:
binder - LWDataBinder to check for errors
Returns:
boolean returned indicating whether any errors were found

java.lang.Exception

getContent

public java.lang.String getContent(java.lang.String contentId,
                                   java.lang.String encoding)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Method that returns the content of a Stellent content item as a string. The content item's contentId and file encoding should be passed, if no file encoding is passed the Global DEFAULT_ENCODING is used.
This method should only be used for content items which can be interpretted as strings (such as text and XML files).

Parameters:
contentId - dDocName of the Stellent content item whose content will be retrieved
encoding - The encoding of the content item being retrieved (e.g. UTF8, ASCII)
Returns:
String holding content item's content
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getContent

public java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream getContent(java.lang.String contentId)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Method that returns the content of a Stellent content item as a byte array. The content item's contentId should be passed. The returned byte array can be read to file or transformed as necessary.

Parameters:
contentId - dDocName of the Stellent content item whose content will be retrieved
Returns:
ByteArrayOutputStream holding content item's content
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
FileUtils.readBytesToFile(ByteArrayOutputStream baos, String extension)

getContent

public java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream getContent(java.lang.String contentId,
                                                long dID,
                                                java.lang.String rendition)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Method that returns the content of a Stellent content item as a byte array. The content item's contentId and dID should be passed. If the dID is less than zero the method will simply return the latest Released version of the content item. The returned byte array can be read to file or transformed as necessary.

Parameters:
contentId - dDocName of the Stellent content item whose content will be retrieved
dID - dID of the Stellent content item if a specific revision is to be retrieved
rendition - If null then the Primary rendition is always returned, set to Web to return the web rendition
Returns:
ByteArrayOutputStream holding content item's content
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
FileUtils.readBytesToFile(ByteArrayOutputStream baos, String extension)

getLatestContent

public java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream getLatestContent(java.lang.String contentId)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
Method that returns the LATEST content of a Stellent content item as a byte array rather than the LATEST RELEASED version which is normally returned. The content item's contentId should be passed. The returned byte array can be read to file or transformed as necessary.

Parameters:
contentId - dDocName of the Stellent content item whose content will be retrieved
Returns:
ByteArrayOutputStream holding content item's content
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
FileUtils.readBytesToFile(ByteArrayOutputStream baos, String extension)

getLatestContent

public java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream getLatestContent(java.lang.String contentId,
                                                      java.lang.String rendition)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
Method that returns the LATEST content of a Stellent content item as a byte array rather than the LATEST RELEASED version which is normally returned. The content item's contentId should be passed. The returned byte array can be read to file or transformed as necessary.

Parameters:
contentId - dDocName of the Stellent content item whose content will be retrieved
rendition - If null then the Primary rendition is always returned, set to Web to return the web rendition
Returns:
ByteArrayOutputStream holding content item's content
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
FileUtils.readBytesToFile(ByteArrayOutputStream baos, String extension)

checkInNew

public java.lang.String checkInNew(java.lang.String folderId,
                                   java.lang.String docName,
                                   java.lang.String docType,
                                   java.lang.String title,
                                   java.lang.String author,
                                   java.lang.String securityGroup,
                                   java.lang.String account,
                                   java.lang.String fileName)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
Checks in a new document.

Parameters:
folderId - Id of the collection the document should be added to, if null document is not added to a folder
docName - Document dDocName (ContentID) of new document, can be null if Stellent uses automatically assigns ids
docType - Document type of new document
title - Document title
author - Document author, if null will use logged in user
securityGroup - Security group of the document
account - Security account of the document, if null no account set
fileName - Fully qualified path to the document content
Returns:
The dDocName (ContentID) of the newly created document
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkOut

public void checkOut(java.lang.String dID,
                     java.lang.String dDocName)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Checks out a document for editing.

Parameters:
dID - The dID of the document
dDocName - The dDocName of the document
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkin

public java.lang.String checkin(java.lang.String folderId,
                                java.lang.String docType,
                                java.lang.String docName,
                                java.lang.String dId,
                                java.lang.String revisionId,
                                java.lang.String title,
                                java.lang.String author,
                                java.lang.String securityGroup,
                                java.lang.String account,
                                java.lang.String fileName)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Checks in a new revision of an existing document.

Parameters:
folderId - Id of the collection the document should be added to, if null document is not added to a folder or remains in existing folder
docType - Document type of document
docName - dDocName of the document
dId - dID of the document
revisionId - Revision Id of the new revision (it should be at least one greater than the current revision)
title - Document title
author - Document author, if null will use logged in user
securityGroup - Security group of the document
account - Security account of the document, if null no account set
fileName - Fully qualified path to the document content
Returns:
The dID of the new document revision
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkIn

public java.lang.String checkIn(idcbean.data.LWDataBinder binder,
                                java.lang.String fileName)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Checks in a document using the passed binder object. If the binder includes a dId this is assumed to be a new revision of an existing document. If no dId is present the document is assumed to be new. If checking in a new document the document's dDocName is returned otherwise the documents dId is returned

Parameters:
binder - Container holding the document information
fileName - Fully qualified path to the document content
Returns:
The dDocName (ContentID) or dId of the created document
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

checkIn

public java.lang.String checkIn(idcbean.data.LWDataBinder binder,
                                java.lang.String primaryFileName,
                                java.lang.String altFileName)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
Checks in a document using the passed binder object. If the binder includes a dId this is assumed to be a new revision of an existing document. If no dId is present the document is assumed to be new. If checking in a new document the document's dDocName is returned otherwise the documents dId is returned

Parameters:
binder - Container holding the document information
primaryFileName - Fully qualified path to the document content
altFileName - Fully qualified path to the web-viewable content (optional)
Returns:
The dDocName (ContentID) or dId of the created document
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

createFolder

public java.lang.String createFolder(java.lang.String parentId,
                                     java.lang.String folderName)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a folder with the name folderName as a subfolder of parentId.

Parameters:
parentId - dCollectionId of the new folder's parent
folderName - The name of the new folder
Returns:
The dCollectionId of the newly created folder
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getFolderStructure

public java.util.Hashtable getFolderStructure()
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
Returns the complete SCS folder structure as a Hashtable. The Hashtable key is a fully qualified folder path (e.g. /Contribution Folders/top_folder/sub_folder1) with the dCollectionId of the lowest child folder (in the example sub_folder1) as the table value.

Returns:
Hashtable containing fully qualified folders and their id
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getSubFolders

public java.util.Hashtable getSubFolders(java.lang.String folderId)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Returns a Hashtable with a list of all the (immediate) child folders of the passed parent folderId. The returned table also includes the dCollectionId of the folder as a value against the folder name.

Parameters:
folderId - dCollectionId of the parent folder
Returns:
Hashtable containing the folder name and id of all subfolders
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getFolderId

public java.lang.String getFolderId(java.lang.String path)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
For a given path of the form /xxx/yyyy/zzzz it returns the dCollectionId of folder zzzz. If the folder does not exist it is automatically created by this function.

Parameters:
path -
Returns:
dCollectionId of this folder
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

isNameUnique

public java.lang.String isNameUnique(java.lang.String folderId,
                                     java.lang.String originalName)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
When a document is added to a Stellent folder its dOriginalName which is its filename (rather than title) must be unique. If it is not unique an error is thrown. This utility checks whether the passed name clashes with the dOriginalName of any existing documents in the folder. If an existing match is found it returns the dDocName of the Stellent object, otherwise the function returns null.

Parameters:
folderId -
originalName -
Returns:
dDocName of the existing object with the same originalName
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
